result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonah Michael Marker Jr

records.addlTxt:
8:53 AM Defendant Jonah Michael Marker Jr in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jonah Michael Marker Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is waiting for discovery and requests another status date in approximately 45 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 10/4/22.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witnesses/McDonalds listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:35 PM Defendant Jonah Michael Marker Jr in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Attorney Daniel Gutierrez appears as friend of the court.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
